lead_paragraph: LOWE--James Dyer, was born on June 27th, 1929 in Pittsburgh, PA. He was predeceased by his parents Laura Dyer and William Lowe and his brother, Bill Lowe. Jim passed away peacefully on June 1st at 5:52pm at home in Manhattan with his loving partner of 26 years, Sheldon A Smith, at his side. He attended Washington and Jefferson College and served in the US Army and was stationed in Honolulu, Hawaii and Baltimore, MD. His career included being Director of Public Events at the Campbell-Ewald Advertising Agency, the National Council on Alcoholism, the National Heart Association and Director of Development at New York Presbyterian Hospital. Jim loved his home in Southampton, watching old movies with Sheldon, reading, sitting on the beach and telling wonderful stories about the celebrities he met during his work career. Jim was an elegant, most charming man who will be missed by all who knew him. Services Tuesday, June 7th, 9:30am, Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church-73/74 Streets. 1/3
